description:
spec: more clarification about deferred functions
Proposed new text to make matters clearer. The existing text was
unclear about the state of result parameters when panicking.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

https://codereview.appspot.com/6653047/diff/1/doc/go_spec.html File doc/go_spec.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/6653047/diff/1/doc/go_spec.html#newcode4760 doc/go_spec.html:4760: run-time panic occurs, as described The reference to the run-time panic section seems slightly misleading to me in isolation. That section is only about panics triggered by the runtime. I think that suggests that deferred functions are not run when the panic function is called. https://codereview.appspot.com/6653047/diff/1/doc/go_spec.html#newcode5080 doc/go_spec.html:5080: F returns to its caller with executing the rest of s/with/without/ ?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, iant@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

LGTM https://codereview.appspot.com/6653047/diff/3002/doc/go_spec.html File doc/go_spec.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/6653047/diff/3002/doc/go_spec.html#newcode4738 doc/go_spec.html:4738: (See aslo the section on handling panics.) s/aslo/also/

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, iant@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=66d7f5cb2d22 ***

spec: more clarification about deferred functions
Proposed new text to make matters clearer. The existing text was
unclear about the state of result parameters when panicking.

R=golang-dev, iant
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6653047

subject: code review 6653047: spec: more clarification about deferred functions
